__e: How can I ask this girl to forgive her father when I've barely begun to forgive myself for what I did to you?

Well, actually no one has ever asked me to do this before. I've never done this so I suppose the theory is that with God's forgiveness for what you've done in the past, and God forgives everything, you can always start over.
I don't know how to forget And I don't ask forgiveness, for I forgive no one
And forgive the following sentence, but all that matters right now is that you keep the music alive.
Forgive me if I have a hard time taking you at your word.
I did not mean what I said.
Her we do not forgive, nor do we ask her forgiveness.
I can't forgive you for the way my son spoke to me yesterday.
Because I do not forgive your people for taking the life of my father, and his father, and his father before him.
Her I can forgive... but you I can't.
I forgive you any wrong you have done me... and I ask you to forgive me for all the wrong I have done to you.
BECAUSE I FORGIVE YOU, MY DARLING.
And what if one of my other patients, or, God forbid, my wife, ends up in the hospital?
And forgive my husband. He knows not what he does.
